Pawelk198604, try to lay outside in the shade (don't roast on the sun without sunscreen) and just experience the day for a few hours, and then 2 hours before you want to go to bed, don't watch TV and don't use your computer. Biggest thing for me is getting some exercise. I don't generally have trouble sleeping if I've been out for a run, or gone for a swim.

Another thing I find helpful is a basic form of meditation. Just concentrate on your breathing, try and avoid thinking about anything else at all. Then start consciously relaxing your muscles. Start with your jaw and move downwards, spend about 20-30 seconds just trying to make each one as relaxed as possible. I usually end up dropping off before I've finished my arms.
